citation.article-title: Novel facultative anaerobic acidotolerant Telmatospirillum siberiense gen. nov. sp. nov. isolated from mesotrophic fen.

p.s: Telmatospirillum (Tel.ma.to.spi.ril’lum Gr.n. telma -atos, marsh, swamp, fen; N.L. dim neut. n. Spirillum, a bacterial genus; N.L. neut. n. Telmatospirillum, a fen Spirillum).
Cells are vibrioid to spiral shaped, motile by means of polar or subpolar flagella.
Gram negative and belong to the Alphaproteobacteria. Major cellular fatty acids are 18:1 ω7c, 17:0 cyclopropane and 16:0.
Cells grow chemoorganotrophically under anoxic conditions or low oxygen pressure in the dark as well autotrophically on H2+CO2 at low oxygen pressure, being tolerant up to 5 kPa of oxygen.
Growth temperature range is 4–30 °C; pH range is 4–7.
Growth is supported by several organic acids and glucose.
Liquid medium is superior to solid agar medium.
The mole G+C ratio of the DNA is 61.6–64%.
Habitat: northern acidic wetlands under Sphagnum (bogs, mires, fens).
